Moo::ViewportSetter

Moo::ViewportSetter Class Reference

This class is a scoped viewport setter, allowing you to easily set a new viewport on the device. More...

Detailed Description

This class is a scoped viewport setter, allowing you to easily set a new viewport on the device.

The previous settings are restored automatically when the class goes out of scope.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Moo::ViewportSetter::ViewportSetter (  ) 

This constructor takes no arguments.

It simply rememebers the current viewport state, and sets it on the device when the object goes out of scope.

Moo::ViewportSetter::ViewportSetter ( uint32  width,
uint32  height 
)

This constructor takes a width and height and sets a new temporary viewport on the device using the passed in values and the existing values of the old viewport.

Parameters:
width new viewport width.
height new viewport height.

Moo::ViewportSetter::ViewportSetter ( uint32  x,
uint32  y,
uint32  width,
uint32  height 
)

This constructor takes x and y, width, height and sets a new temporary viewport on the device using the passed in values and the existing values of the old viewport.

Parameters:
x x pixel offset of top left corner of new viewport.
y y pixel offset of top left corner of new viewport.
width new viewport width.
height new viewport height.

Moo::ViewportSetter::ViewportSetter ( uint32  width,
uint32  height,
uint32  x,
uint32  y,
float  minZ,
float  maxZ 
)

This constructor takes x and y, width, height and min and max Z and sets a new temporary viewport on the device using the passed in values.

Parameters:
x x pixel offset of top left corner of new viewport.
y y pixel offset of top left corner of new viewport.
width new viewport width.
height new viewport height.
minZ new viewport minimum Z value.
maxZ new viewport maximum Z value.

Moo::ViewportSetter::~ViewportSetter (  ) 

This destructor automatically resets the saved viewport when the class goes out of scope.
